intro: Spergularia media subsp. media, commonly known as sea sandspurry, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in coastal environments, particularly in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually succulent and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in arid conditions. It is often found in dunes and other coastal habitats where it plays a role in stabilizing sand and preventing erosion.
